intro: Gayoides, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Goodeniaceae. These plants are typically found in coastal regions and are adapted to saline and sandy soils. They are characterized by their distinctive blue or purple flowers and silver-gray foliage. The genus includes several species, such as Gayoides maritimus, which is native to the Mediterranean and Atlantic coasts. Gayoides plants are often cultivated for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in challenging environments.
